summary: Email correspondence between a defense attorney and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding logistical arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell to receive discovery materials on a new drive while detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The defense requests weekend laptop access and offers to hand-deliver the drive.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; detained at MDC and needs access to discovery materials on a new drive. Defense is requesting she be allowed to use a laptop on weekends.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Correspondent from the U.S. Attorney's Office handling logistics for delivering discovery materials to Maxwell; indicates no objection to weekend laptop use.

connections.person2: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Prosecutor handling the case against defendant Maxwell, coordinating discovery material delivery.

events.title: Discovery Delivery Coordination
events.description: Email exchange regarding arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell to receive discovery materials on a new drive, with the defense offering to hand-deliver it to MDC.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: Defense counsel requested Ghislaine Maxwell be permitted to use a laptop on weekends, citing inefficiency of MDC computers.
The U.S. Attorney's Office had no objection to Maxwell using the laptop on weekends.
A new drive with discovery materials was being prepared for Maxwell, as she was unable to view the previously provided CD.
Defense counsel offered to pick up and hand-deliver the drive to MDC to expedite access for Maxwell over the weekend.
The correspondence highlights logistical challenges in providing discovery to a detained defendant.
